page.title: 13COPPERAS WOOD - TREES
page.content: There are{twenty five species}of tree in the wood.Apart from the sweet chestnut there are:- Scots Pine: Blackthorn: Lime: Oak: Elderberry: Hornbeam: Hazel: Mapel: Horse Chestnut: Holly: Sycamore: Hawthorn: Spindle: Small Leaf Lime: Ash: Dogwood: Elm. The{Essex Naturalist Trust}are beginning to manage the wood again, {coppicing}it as it was for hundreds of years. In a 15 year cycle areas of the wood are cut for the timber, which is sold. The natural vegetation is, for the first time for generations, then allowed to grow. First the wild flowers appear, like the Red Campion, followed by nettles as the trees begin to grow again. Finally brambles become established before they give way to the trees which block out the light.These are then cut again.
